alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Marshall (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 3:05AM CST until February 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River Near Shelbyville affecting Bedford and Marshall Counties. For the Duck River...including Manchester, Shelbyville, Pottsville, Milltown, Columbia, Centerville, Hurricane Mills...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Duck River Near Shelbyville. * WHEN...From early this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Water continues to impact low lying areas along the river, agriculutral land, and access points including the Dement Bridge boat ramp, the Three Forks Bridge canoe and kayak access point, the Mullins Mill Bridge access point, and River Botttom Park and Fisherman`s Park in Shelbyville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 20.0 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.5 feet this evening. - Action stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 915 PM CST.
